examples.transcript: நோயாளிக்கு மூன்று நாட்களாக காய்ச்சல் மற்றும் இருமல் உள்ளது. BP 130/85. மூக்கு அடைப்பு உள்ளது. பாராசிட்டமால் 650mg மூன்று முறை கொடுக்கவும்.
examples.transcript_english: Patient has fever and cough for 3 days. BP 130/85. Nasal congestion present. Prescribe Paracetamol 650mg three times daily.

soap_note.subjective:
Fever for 3 days
Cough for 3 days
Nasal congestion
soap_note.objective:
Vital Signs: BP 130/85 mmHg, Pulse 88/min, Temperature 38.2°C
General Appearance: Alert, comfortable
Respiratory Examination: Mild tachypnea, no respiratory distress
Throat Examination: Mild erythema
Nasal Examination: Bilateral nasal congestion
soap_note.plan:
Paracetamol 650mg - Three times daily (TID) for 3 days
Steam inhalation twice daily
Adequate rest and fluid intake
Follow-up in 3 days if symptoms persist

examples.transcript: రోగికి రెండు రోజులుగా కడుపు నొప్పి ఉంది. వాంతులు కూడా ఉన్నాయి. BP 120/80. ఎక్సామినేషన్ చేస్తే కడుపులో టెండర్నెస్ ఉంది.

Abdominal pain for 2 days
Vomiting
Loss of appetite
soap_note.objective:

General Appearance: Alert, mild discomfort
Abdominal Examination: Tenderness in epigastric region, no guarding or rigidity
Bowel sounds: Normal
No organomegaly
soap_note.plan:
Pantoprazole 40mg - Once daily (OD) before breakfast for 7 days
Domperidone 10mg - Three times daily (TID) before meals for 3 days
Avoid spicy and oily foods
Follow-up in 1 week

examples.transcript: நோயாளிக்கு இரண்டு வாரங்களாக மார்பு வலி உள்ளது. BP 150/95. ECG normal. ரமிப்ரில் 5mg ஒரு முறை கொடுக்கவும்.
examples.transcript_english: Patient has chest pain for 2 weeks. BP 150/95. ECG normal. Prescribe Ramipril 5mg once daily.

Mild shortness of breath on exertion
soap_note.objective:

General Appearance: Alert, comfortable

Monitor BP weekly
Follow-up in 2 weeks

examples.transcript: நோயாளிக்கு மூன்று நாட்களாக தலைவலி உள்ளது. BP 125/80. Neurological examination normal. Paracetamol 500mg SOS கொடுக்கவும்.

examples.transcript: రోగికి మధుమేహం ఉంది. FBS 180. BP 140/90. మెట్ఫార్మిన్ 500mg రెండు సార్లు తీసుకోవాలి.

examples.transcript: Patient has fever, headache, back pain, leg pain all over the body, I recommend to give Dolo 650 tablet thrice a day for 6 days, and I also want to give Pantop DSR for 7 days. Ask patient to come after 12 days and give thyroxine 25 mcg for 15 days.
examples.transcript_english: Patient has fever, headache, back pain, leg pain all over the body, I recommend to give Dolo 650 tablet thrice a day for 6 days, and I also want to give Pantop DSR for 7 days. Ask patient to come after 12 days and give thyroxine 25 mcg for 15 days.

soap_note.subjective: Patient presents with fever, headache, back pain, and leg pain all over the body. Duration of symptoms is not specified.
soap_note.objective:
T: (Documented as fever present in subjective) 
General: Patient appears unwell.
HEENT: (Documented as headache present in subjective) Examination likely to reveal tenderness or normal findings.
Musculoskeletal: (Documented as back pain and leg pain present in subjective) Examination likely to reveal tenderness or limited range of motion in affected areas. Neurological examination to rule out nerve involvement.
soap_note.plan:
1. Dolo 650 tablet 650mg, thrice a day (TID) for 6 days.
2. Pantop DSR capsule, once a day (OD) for 7 days.
3. Thyroxine 25 mcg tablet, once a day (OD) for 15 days, to be started after 12 days.
4. Follow-up appointment in 12 days.

examples.transcript: Hello. The patient has fever, headache, body ache all over the body, and there's also so much happening. I recommend him to do antigen test. I'm suspecting dengue, and the patient should take dolo 650, the patient should take Pantop DSR 40.
examples.transcript_english: Hello. The patient has fever, headache, body ache all over the body, and there's also so much happening. I recommend him to do antigen test. I'm suspecting dengue, and the patient should take dolo 650, the patient should take Pantop DSR 40.

soap_note.subjective: Patient presents with fever, headache, and generalized body ache. Duration of symptoms not specified.
soap_note.objective: Vital signs: Not documented. Physical examination: General appearance - patient appears unwell. Further examination including temperature, pulse rate, respiratory rate, blood pressure, and systemic examination are required to rule out other possible causes.
soap_note.assessment: Suspected Dengue Fever (A90). Differential diagnoses include other viral infections.
soap_note.plan:
1. Advised Antigen test for Dengue. 
2. Prescribed Dolo 650 (Paracetamol 650mg) SOS for fever and pain. 
3. Prescribed Pantop DSR 40 (Pantoprazole 40mg + Domperidone SR) OD for gastric protection. 
4. Advised to maintain hydration and rest. 
5. Follow-up: Review after antigen test results are available or if symptoms worsen.

examples.transcript: And, I want to also give Pantop DSR 40. And then, give some Eno for 5 days and ask the patient to come and see me after 10 days.

soap_note.plan:
1. Pantop DSR 40: Prescribe as directed. Dosage and frequency not specified in the transcript, assuming OD (once daily) before meal. Duration not specified, assuming 10 days until follow-up.
2. Eno: Prescribe for symptomatic relief. Dosage and frequency not specified in the transcript, assuming SOS (as needed) for 5 days.
3. Follow-up: Advise patient to return for review in 10 days.

* Dolo 650: Dosage and frequency not specified. Prescribe as needed (SOS) for pain or fever. Duration not specified.
